intro: Trithrinax schizophylla, commonly known as the Mexican palm or the spiny palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to the Yucatán Peninsula and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and arid conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing at the base of the leaves, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Trithrinax schizophylla plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for native fauna.
